H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H2299.def: = pertaining to having a thin cutting edge; ► in order to make it useful and effective as a tool; ≈ often associated with aggression and danger

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H1532.def: = person whose trade is cutting hair and related services

H8593.def: = sharp knife ► used to shave hair from the skin; also used to sharpen one's pen

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H2206.def: = a growth of hair on the chin and lower cheeks of a mature man’s face, ≈ the absence of which is regarded as shameful

H3976.def: = contraption consisting of rod held by a cord in the middle and with pans attached to both ends; ► used for weighing objects; sometimes used figuratively in expressions describing people's status or integrity or the seriousness of a situation in terms of weight

H4948.def: = a measure of the heaviness of an object

H2505.def: = causative action by which humans or deities divide an object (or range of objects) into portions; ► usually with the intention to use one or more of these portions for a particular purpose

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H4692.def: = state of severe sorrow or anguish

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H1197.def: = process by which someone or something is harmed or destroyed by fire

H7992.def: = state in which a countable entity is the third in a range

H217.def: = fire; ► used for burning sacrifices and other objects, setting fire to arrows, and warming oneself; ≈ associated with light, warmth, and destruction

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H4592.def: = small quantity of objects or substance

H4557.def: = an oral or written account of something

H6696.def: = causative action by which humans attach one or more objects to another object that contains an opening ► in order to block entry and/or exit

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3671.def: = part of body; ◄ of bird, insect, celestial creature; ► used for flying but also to give protection

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H8313.def: = process by which an object is consumed by fire

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3069.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H4784.def: = action by which humans reject the authority of a ruler or deity to which they had formerly been subjected

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H7564.def: = action by which humans act in a way that is contrary to (God's) law, ► resulting in a state of guilt

H2708.def: = patterns of behavior that a community expects its members to follow

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3988.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H1995.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, sometimes associated with natural phenomena like heavy rain and the waves of a stormy sea

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H8201.def: = difficult circumstances ≈  regarded as a direct punishment from God

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H5002.def: = action by which humans or deities make a prophetic statement; in the case of a deity this is usually done through the mouth of a prophet or seer

H2930.def: = process by which humans, or objects are or become contaminated, ◄ as a result of contagious diseases or conditions, unlawful activities, or contact with what has been contaminated, ► which often results in their inability of being used or participating in social and religious activities, until this state is reversed through prescribed rituals and procedures

H4720.def: = part of an object that is considered more holy than the rest

H8251.def: = an object that is regarded as unclean and therefore treated as utterly detestable

H8441.def: = state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H1639.def: = causative action by which humans cut off (part of) their hair

H2347.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to do something that may have a negative effect on someone or something else; ◄ usually caused by an emotion of affection or compassion

H7992.def: = state in which a countable entity is the third in a range

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H1698.def: in a strict sense: = an epidemic disease ► that causes high mortality; in a wider sense: = any widespread affliction, calamity, or evil, ≈ especially one regarded as a direct punishment by God

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H7458.def: = state of having a lack of food for a period of time, affecting an individual for a short time or a large number of people in a geographical area for a prolonged time (as in famine)

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H5117.def: = action by which humans or animals stop their current or regular activities, ► often with the purpose of recovering their strength

H2534.def: = poisonous fluid; ◄ secreted by serpents, scorpions, etc. and introduced into body of victim by bite or sting; ► used by these animals to kill their prey and/or defend themselves against their natural enemies; ≈ often used to denote suffering and injury in a more general sense as well

H5162.def: = causative action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7068.def: = process by which humans or deities experience a sentiment of anger  for the sake of someone else, ◄ because that other person does not receive the attention, commitment, or treatment that they are entitled to

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H2723.def: = state in which a land, building, or town has been totally destroyed, ► to the extent that nobody can live there anymore

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H1422.def: = action by which a human being utters words that are intended to provoke shame in someone else

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H4923.def: = state in which an area has become empty as a result of destruction and depopulation

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H2671.def: = pointed missile, shot from a bow; slender and straight in shape and moving swiftly; ◄ made out of wood and/or iron; ► mainly used for hunting, in warfare, and occasionally for divination; ≈ symbol of aggression, affliction, and punishment

H7458.def: = state of having a lack of food for a period of time, affecting an individual for a short time or a large number of people in a geographical area for a prolonged time (as in famine)

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H4889.def: = causative action or process by which humans, deities, or animals cause (other) humans, animals, or objects to be affected by violence, destruction, death, putrefaction, pollution, blemishes, and other factors that may have a destructive or deadly impact

H7843.def: = process by which objects are affected by violence, destruction, putrefaction, pollution, blemishes, and other factors that may have a destructive impact

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

48.gl: to break the staff of bread > to break the supply of bread

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land
